skill.name: aeon
skill.description: This skill should be used for time series machine learning tasks including classification, regression, clustering, forecasting, anomaly detection, segmentation, and similarity search. Use when working with temporal data, sequential patterns, or time-indexed observations requiring specialized algorithms beyond standard ML approaches. Particularly suited for univariate and multivariate time series analysis with scikit-learn compatible APIs.

content.user_title: Analyze time series data with Aeon
content.value_statement: Time series data requires specialized algorithms for classification, forecasting, and anomaly detection. Aeon provides a scikit-learn compatible toolkit with state-of-the-art algorithms for temporal analysis tasks.
actual_capabilities: Classify time series using convolution-based, deep learning, and distance-based algorithms
Forecast future values with ARIMA, exponential smoothing, and temporal convolutional networks
Detect anomalies and outliers using matrix profile and isolation-based methods
Cluster similar time series patterns with specialized distance metrics
Segment time series at change points and regime boundaries
Find similar patterns and motifs with similarity search algorithms
limitations: Requires Python environment with aeon library installed
Processing very long time series may require significant memory
Deep learning methods require GPU for optimal performance
Some algorithms require equal-length time series inputs

prompt_templates.title: Classify time series
prompt_templates.prompt: Classify this time series data using aeon. Use MiniRocketClassifier for speed. Load data from aeon.datasets and report accuracy on the test set.

prompt_templates.title: Detect anomalies
prompt_templates.prompt: Detect anomalies in this sensor data using aeon. Use the STOMP algorithm with appropriate window size. Flag points exceeding the 95th percentile as anomalies.

prompt_templates.title: Forecast values
prompt_templates.prompt: Forecast the next 7 days of values using aeon. Use ARIMA or TCNForecaster. Provide prediction intervals if possible.

prompt_templates.title: Find patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Find repeated motifs in this time series using aeon similarity search. Use StompMotif with window size appropriate for the data. Report the locations of discovered patterns.

output_examples.input: Classify this ECG time series into normal and abnormal using aeon
output: Loaded training and test data from aeon.datasets
Model achieved 94.2% accuracy on test set

best_practices: Normalize time series before analysis using Normalizer transformer
Use window constraints with DTW to prevent overfitting and improve speed
Start with simple methods like MiniRocket before deep learning
Validate on held-out data to avoid data leakage from preprocessing
anti_patterns: Using deep learning on small datasets without transfer learning
Skipping data normalization before distance-based algorithms
Applying point anomaly detection to subsequence anomalies
Ignoring the train/test split when using built-in dataset loaders

faq.question: What time series formats does aeon support?
faq.answer: Aeon expects numpy arrays with shape (n_samples, n_channels, n_timepoints). Supports unequal lengths for elastic distances.

faq.question: What is the fastest classification algorithm?
faq.answer: MiniRocketClassifier offers excellent speed with strong accuracy. Use Arsenal for larger ensembles when more compute is available.

faq.question: Can I use aeon with sklearn pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Aeon transformers and classifiers follow sklearn conventions. Use sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline to chain transformers with classifiers.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using aeon?
faq.answer: Aeon processes data locally in your Python environment. No data is sent to external servers. All computation happens on your machine.

faq.question: Why are my anomaly scores all low?
faq.answer: Ensure data is normalized before detection. Check that window size matches the expected anomaly length. Use percentile-based thresholds instead of fixed values.

faq.question: How does aeon compare to other time series libraries?
faq.answer: Aeon offers the broadest algorithm selection with scikit-learn compatibility. Alternatives like pyts focus on specific methods while aeon covers classification, forecasting, and anomaly detection.
